isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - CATERPILLAR 3176B/3406E ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - 1994 - ELECTRICAL OPERATION - ENGINE BRAKE CONTROLS

svcprocinfo.para:
Refer to
CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS, Figure 6.06 or 6.09
for this discussion.

figure.caption: Figure 6.06 - Caterpillar 3176B Engine Brake And J1922 ABS Connection
Figure 6.09 - Caterpillar 3406E - Engine Brake And J1922 ABS Connector

svcprocinfo.para: This manual only discusses engine brake control circuits and components installed by International: the Engine Brake ON/OFF switch (412), the Engine Brake Selector switch (411) and the connecting circuits. The International installed Clutch Switch (55) and Service Brake Switch (317) also provide inputs to the Engine Brake Control System and are discussed in paragraphs Service Brake Switch and Clutch Switch
For a complete description of Engine Brake Operation, refer to the appropriate Caterpillar Service Manual.
There are two owner selected Engine Brake operation modes, which are COAST and LATCH.

svcsubproc.title: COAST Operation Mode
svcsubproc.para: If the COAST mode (standard mode) is selected, the engine brake operates when:

step1.para: The driver's foot is off the throttle pedal (throttle position less than 7%).
The Service Brake pedal is depressed (engine brake only operates while service brake is applied).
The cruise control switch can be in the ON position, although it will be disabled by applying the service brake.

svcsubproc.title: LATCH Operation Mode
svcsubproc.para: If the LATCH mode is selected, the engine brake operates when:

step1.para: The driver's foot is off the throttle pedal (throttle position less than 7%).
The cruise control switch must be OFF.

The engine brake operates when the driver applies the service brake, but the engine brake continues to operate (LATCHES ON so to speak) after the driver takes his foot off the brake. The engine brake stays engaged (LATCHED ON) until one of the other ECM inputs changes: clutch pedal depressed, throttle pedal depressed, engine speed drops below 950 rpm or the brake pedal is depressed a second time.

svcsubproc.title: Engine Brake Control
svcsubproc.para: Control of the engine brake is shared by the driver and the ECM. The driver turns the engine brake ON or OFF and selects how much engine brake is desired (number of cylinders). The ECM monitors certain engine parameters, then enables the engine brake system when all conditions are acceptable.

svcsubproc.title: Engine Brake With Antilock Brake System
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to
CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS, Figure 6.06or 6.09
, for this discussion.

When Antilock Brakes (ABS) are installed with an Engine Brake also installed, the ABS controller is connected to the ECM through J1922 connector (6). This connection allows the ABS controller to communicate with the ECM by serial data circuits 98Z(+) and 98Y(-). These circuits are a twisted wire pair. This allows the ECM to TURN OFF the engine brake when the ABS system detects that a vehicle wheel is encountering a slippery road surface.

svcsubproc.title: ON/OFF Switch (412)
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to
CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS, Figure 6.06 or 6.09
, for this discussion.

To ENABLE (turn on) the Engine Brake Control System, this switch must be ON (closed). With the On/Off switch closed the circuit between ECM connector (558) terminal 29 and the Engine Brake selector switch terminal 2 is complete.

svcsubproc.title: Engine Brake Selector Switch (411)
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to
CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS, Figure 6.06 or 6.09
, for this discussion.
The Engine Brake Selector Switch has three circuits, Low, Medium and a common or ground circuit connected to the engine brake On/Off switch.

Selector switch terminal 2, is connected by circuit 24AJ to the Engine Brake On/Off switch (412) at terminal 6. When the On/Off switch is ON, the circuit between the engine brake selector switch (411) terminal 2 and ECM connector (558) terminal 29 is complete.

The LOW circuit, 24AF, from the Selector switch (411) terminal 3, is connected to connector (558) terminal 19. The Medium circuit, 24AE, from Selector switch (411) terminal 6, is connected to connector (558) terminal 13.
With the Selector switch (411) in the Low position, the ECM sees a 0 volt signal at connector (558) terminal 19 and a 5 volt signal at terminal 13.
With the Selector switch (411) in the Medium position, the ECM sees a 0 volt signal at connector (558) terminal 13 and a 5 volt signal at terminal 19.
With the Selector switch (411) in the High position, the ECM sees a 0 volt signal at connector (558) terminal 13 and 19.
